metadata.title: Frontend & Web Development Roadmaps - Comprehensive Analysis
metadata.description: Detailed learning paths for 11 key frontend and web development specializations

1_frontend_developer.title: Frontend Developer Roadmap
1_frontend_developer.description: Complete path to becoming a frontend developer - encompasses all frontend technologies and frameworks

topics: HTML fundamentals - semantic markup, forms, accessibility
CSS basics - selectors, box model, positioning, styling
JavaScript fundamentals - syntax, data types, functions, DOM manipulation
Git basics and version control workflow
CSS modern layout systems - Flexbox, CSS Grid
JavaScript advanced - async/await, promises, API calls
Frontend framework basics (React, Vue, or Angular)
Testing fundamentals - unit and component testing
Framework mastery - advanced patterns and best practices
Performance optimization - bundle size, lazy loading
Building design systems and component libraries
Advanced testing - E2E testing, integration testing

learning_path: 2. Master CSS3 and modern layout systems
3. Master JavaScript ES6+ and DOM APIs
6. Choose and master a primary framework (React/Vue/Angular)

2_react_developer.title: React Developer Roadmap
2_react_developer.description: Complete guide to mastering React and its ecosystem for modern web development

state_management: Redux Toolkit - for complex global state
Context API + useReducer - for simple state

3_vue_developer.title: Vue Developer Roadmap
3_vue_developer.description: Master Vue.js 3 with Composition API and modern ecosystem for scalable web apps

fundamentals: Template syntax and directives (v-if, v-for, v-bind, v-on)
composition_api: Reactive state with ref() and reactive()

state_management: Composition API composables - for simple state
VueUse - collection of Vue composition utilities
routing: Vue Router v4+ - official routing library

specializations: Single Page Applications (SPA) with Vue Router
Mobile development with NativeScript or Framework7
learning_topics_order: 7. Vue Router for single page apps

4_angular_developer.title: Angular Developer Roadmap
4_angular_developer.description: Complete guide to mastering Angular framework for enterprise-grade applications
framework_fundamentals: Components - building blocks of Angular apps
Angular CLI for project setup and generation

reactive_programming: Common operators - map, switchMap, mergeMap, debounceTime, catchError

5_nextjs_developer.title: Next.js Developer Roadmap
5_nextjs_developer.description: Master Next.js for full-stack React applications with advanced rendering strategies

rendering_strategies: Static Site Generation (SSG) - HTML generated at build time
Server-Side Rendering (SSR) - HTML generated on each request
Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR) - hybrid of SSG and SSR
server_components: React Server Components (RSC) in app router
api_routes: HTTP methods - GET, POST, PUT, DELETE

real_world_applications: Content delivery networks for content sites

6_typescript_developer.title: TypeScript Roadmap
6_typescript_developer.description: Master TypeScript type system and advanced features for scalable, type-safe code
type_system_fundamentals: Basic types - string, number, boolean, null, undefined, any
Type annotations for variables, parameters, return types
Union types (|) for multiple possible types
Literal types for precise value types

topics: Utility types - Partial, Required, Pick, Omit, Record
Template literal types for string manipulation

7_javascript_developer.title: JavaScript Roadmap
7_javascript_developer.description: Master core JavaScript language concepts and modern ES6+ features
core_concepts: Functions, operators, and data structures - foundation for frameworks
Dynamic typing and flexible programming model
Procedural, functional, and object-oriented programming paradigms
Asynchronous programming - critical for real-world apps

beginner: Data types - strings, numbers, booleans, null, undefined
Control flow - if/else, switch, loops (for, while)
intermediate: Array methods - map, filter, reduce, forEach, find

real_world_applications.frontend: Interactive websites and user interfaces with DOM manipulation
real_world_applications.backend: REST APIs using Node.js, Bun, or Deno runtimes
real_world_applications.fullstack: Web applications combining frontend and backend

8_css_developer.title: CSS Roadmap
8_css_developer.description: Master CSS layout systems, modern techniques, and responsive design

flexbox.description: One-dimensional layout - arranging items in rows or columns
flexbox.use_cases: Component-level layouts, navigation bars, flexible spacing

css_grid.use_cases: Page-level layouts, complex designs, dashboard layouts

container_queries.description: New responsive technique - query container size not viewport
features: Container query units - cqw, cqh, cqi

modern_techniques: CSS Functions - calc(), min(), max(), clamp()
Responsive units - rem, em, vw, vh, ch

techniques: Relative units - rem, em, %, vh, vw
best_practices: Use px for borders and shadows

beginner: CSS selectors - element, class, ID, attribute
Box model - margin, padding, border, content

9_html_developer.title: HTML Roadmap
9_html_developer.description: Master semantic HTML, accessibility, and web standards

semantic_html.description: Using meaningful elements that describe content purpose
benefits: Better SEO and search engine understanding
Better semantic meaning for readers and bots

wcag_standards: Four principles - Perceivable, Operable, Understandable, Robust
semantic_html_first: Only use ARIA when HTML cannot solve the problem
Semantic HTML has better browser and AT support
Avoid using ARIA to fix bad semantic choices
best_practices: Color is not the only means of conveying information
Keyboard navigability for all interactive elements

learning_topics: 6. Images and media - img, picture, video, audio
forms_and_inputs: Input types - text, email, password, number, date, file, etc.
Form validation attributes - required, pattern, min, max
Accessibility in forms - labels, error messages
best_practices: Use meaningful class and ID names
Use alt text for all images

10_graphql_developer.title: GraphQL Roadmap
10_graphql_developer.description: Master GraphQL API design and implementation for modern applications
core_concepts: Query language for APIs - alternative to REST
fundamentals: Types - scalar, object, interface, union, enum
api_design_patterns: Best practice: Design schema around domains/entities
Avoid overly flat or deeply nested structures
Use nullable vs non-nullable fields strategically
Proper error handling with standardized error types
Caching strategies - HTTP and persisted queries
server_implementation: GraphQL servers - Apollo Server, GraphQL-core, Hasura
Resolvers - functions that return field values
client_libraries: Apollo Client - most popular for React
best_practices: Monitor query complexity to prevent DoS
Use subscriptions for real-time, not polling
Cache appropriately - HTTP caching + persisted queries
comparison_with_rest: GraphQL - request exactly what you need, single endpoint
REST - multiple requests for related data
Both have valid use cases - choose based on needs

11_api_design.title: API Design Roadmap
11_api_design.description: Master REST API design principles, versioning, and best practices
rest_principles: Stateless - each request contains all information
Uniform interface - consistent endpoints and responses
Code on demand (optional) - server can extend functionality

http_methods.PATCH: Partial update - may not be idempotent
http_methods.HEAD: Like GET but no response body

3xx_redirection: 304 Not Modified - resource not changed since last request
4xx_client_error: 405 Method Not Allowed - HTTP method not supported
409 Conflict - request conflicts with current state
5xx_server_error: 500 Internal Server Error - generic server error
504 Gateway Timeout - upstream took too long

nesting_guidelines: Too deep creates long URLs and confusion
Return URIs in response body for deeper relationships

url_path.pros: Explicit, visible in every request, easy routing

error_handling: Include error codes for client handling
HTTP status codes match error type
performance: Query complexity limits to prevent DoS
best_practices_summary: Use standard HTTP methods and status codes

timeline.mid_level: 2-3 years of combined experience across tools
timeline.senior_level: 5+ years with mastery of multiple technologies

approach: Choose one primary framework and master it deeply

plugin_generation_notes.json_structure: Each roadmap role includes metadata, core technologies, skill levels, learning paths, real-world applications, and tool ecosystem
plugin_generation_notes.extensibility: Structure allows easy addition of resources, prerequisites, project examples, and community links
plugin_generation_notes.data_sources: Compiled from developer-roadmap project, roadmap.sh, industry best practices, and community resources
